data.text: But now thus saith the Lord that created thee, O Jacob,
When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee;
For I am the Lord thy God,
Since thou wast precious in my sight,
Fear not: for I am with thee:
I will say to the north, Give up;
Even every one that is called by my name:
Bring forth the blind people that have eyes,
Let all the nations be gathered together,
Ye are my witnesses, saith the Lord,
I, even I, am the Lord;
I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed,
Yea, before the day was I am he;
Thus saith the Lord, your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel;
I am the Lord, your Holy One,
Thus saith the Lord, which maketh a way in the sea,
Which bringeth forth the chariot and horse, the army and the power;
Remember ye not the former things,
Behold, I will do a new thing;
The beast of the field shall honour me,
This people have I formed for myself;
But thou hast not called upon me, O Jacob;
Thou hast not brought me the small cattle of thy burnt offerings;
Thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money,
I, even I, am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake,
Put me in remembrance: let us plead together:
Thy first father hath sinned,
Therefore I have profaned the princes of the sanctuary,
